View

The view begins its life as a template, is merged with the model, and finally rendered into the browser DOM.

components/lure/lure.js

	
			// prepare template
			var template = Handlebars.compile(html);

			// create view from model & template
			var view = template(model);

The View is created when the model-data is merged with a template.

Lure.js uses Handlebars for template interpolation. Handlebars is a very easy framework and you can check out the API reference here Handlebars API.

Model and View are easy enough to understand. You may already be practicing these methods if you pull your data from a database and then use something like Crockford's "supplant" or even Handlebars to inject your data into a template.

If your data never changed this would be all the info you'd need. But users like to interact with things. Updating graphs, adding content, socializing, etc. This is where Controllers come in. They change the model in clever ways and then re-inject that data into the template to create the new view.

Head over to the Controller section to understand the final letter of MVC.
